**Deleveraging and Share Issuance**


```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)
set.seed(1002)
shares_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 50, sd = 2))
market_cap <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 2.25, sd = 0.5))
debt_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 756, sd = 1.5))
share_price <- market_cap * 1000 / shares_outstanding
new_shares_to_issue <- debt_outstanding / share_price
```


Company Y has `r round(shares_outstanding , 2)` million shares outstanding and a market capitalization of `r round(market_cap, 2)` billion.  It also has `r round(debt_outstanding, 2)` million in debt outstanding. The company plans to **delever completely** by issuing new equity and repaying all outstanding debt.   Assume perfect capital markets.  How many new shares must the company issue (in million)?
